results.name: The number of 1-length gaps in all possible covers of n-length line by 2-length segments.
comment: 2-gaps must be filled, so, for example, xxoo doesn't count for n=4. - _Jon Perry_, Nov 18 2014
link: D. Birmajer, J. Gil and M. Weiner, Linear recurrence sequences and their convolutions via Bell polynomials, arXiv:1405.7727 [math.CO], 2014 and J. Int. Seq. 18 (2015) # 15.1.2.
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,2,2,-1,-2,-1).
formula: G.f.: x/(x^3 + x^2 - 1)^2, convolution of A182097 by itself.
example: For n=6 we have xxoxxo, oxxxxo and oxxoxx, so a(6) = number of o's = 6. - _Jon Perry_, Nov 18 2014
maple: A228577 := proc(n) coeftayl(x/(x^3+x^2-1)^2, x=0, n); end proc: seq(A228577(n), n=0..50); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Nov 17 2014
program: (MAGMA) I:=[0,1,0,2,2,3]; [n le 6 select I[n] else 2*Self(n-2)+2*Self(n-3)-Self(n-4)-2*Self(n-5)-Self(n-6): n in [1..50]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Nov 18 2014
